reviews.review_msg: Not tech savvy, which was unfortunate considering this was an online course. Minimal instruction was given on exams, but weekly assignments were fine. As a student who struggles with open endedness, this was a learning experience for me for sure but not a terrible one. Interesting readings.

I don't get why she's so confused that no one shows up. Classes are dry because she reads off a paper and plays videos for lectures, and she has a really negative off putting attitude. She gives minimal, unhelpful feedback and relies on students to drive the entire course. I feel like I've learned nothing new.

Natasha is super blunt, provides very few instructions for her assignments and then degrades her students for not doing well, and shows little to no respect to her students. If you have an emergency and need to miss class don't bother justifying it, she won't waive participation. I emailed her regarding a family emergency and she left me on read.

all she does is play videos in class and give really bad mark on assignments with little to no feedback, her office hours are not helpful, she makes it seems like you have room to be creative and open when writing but don't fall for it (keep in mind she does not give detailed description for assignments, just expects you to know!)

Despite what a lot of people on here are saying, I really enjoyed Dr. Patterson's class! She can be a bit blunt at times which is I think why people don't like her. But I would say that she is much better than a lot of people on here are saying she is. Her lectures are interesting and the readings are easy. Go to class and you will do well!
She was okay, she was pretty easy to get a hold of, and the assignments were laid out clearly. As long as you do the reading and watch the lectures you will do fine.
Professor was extremely blunt in giving feed back, and does so in such a way that makes you feel stupid. Her lectures overall engaging and interesting, the let down with the class is the professor.

She gave off very negative energy and her classes were not engaging. She played a lot of videos in class to fill up class time and her feedback on assignments is far and few. She also takes a very long time to return assignments and post grades. She also releases information for assignments very slowly, with a little tidbit each week.

The prof made this class really unenjoyable, she sat in her chair the entire lecture and read off her notes/was really unengaging during her lectures. She makes the assignments more difficult and stressful because of her lack of communication and unclear expectations. She constantly contradicts herself, and lacks compassion for students.

This was my first GSWS class and I enjoyed it, my enjoyment was due to the course material/ content entirely and unrelevant from the prof. The prof answered everything by saying "read the syllabus". The lectures are quite dry and she can be seen mostly just reading off a script or printed piece of paper; would not want her as my prof ever again.

She was okay, but definitely not as bad as some of the reviews are inferring. I wouldn't be scared going into one of her courses ... just expect unclear grading and getting marked by few things - so watch your grade and make sure you go to lectures! She's nice for the most part and you can tell she enjoys GSWS!

I really didn't like this class. Robotic lectures, lazy grading, random VERY LAST MINUTE cancellations (we seriously missed like 6 classes (once a week lectures), some extenuating circumstances but still really brutal.). Readings were monotonous and boring, and she barely gives you any feedback.

Patterson outlines her expectations very clearly in the first class. Doing the readings will heavily influence your grade, and class participation is not only required but something she enjoys. The essays are fairly open, and she is available for help and consultation. CHECK YOUR EMAIL, she sometimes cancels class last minute.

Lectures were structured poorly. She  provided unclear instructions for assignments and was rude to students who asked for elaboration. Harsh marker and provides very unhelpful feedback. Canceled multiple classes day of.

Natasha is very difficult to work with. She often dismisses questions that can supposedly be answered "in the syllabus" when it is not. Her lectures are very scripted rather than natural, so it feels like I'm watching a presentation. She is on the harsher side of grading and often has an offputting or condescending attitude. I would not recommend.

Knowledgeable, but hard to approach. Tough grader and doesn't leave constructive feedback, comments are often vague and unhelpful. Cancels class last minute, expects students to be able to accommodate to constantly changing schedule. Would not recommend it to students who have heavy courseloads, or are looking to take her class for extra credit.

Would not describe the criteria for assignments effectively. Lectures were robotic and not well structured. Particular about how students follow instructions pertaining to group discussions. Grades assignments harshly and slow. Expect to get grades back at end of the semester. Feedback is unhelpful and vague. Frequently cancelled class the day of

As a GSWS major and someone with a busy schedule outside of school, I would not recommend Natasha. She cancelled 8 classes, put 5 online and expected us to do additional last minute assignments or readings. Although some of the topics and assignments were interesting, the organization of the class was hard to follow and overall frustrating.

Was afraid to take her class due to the ratings I saw however she was very understanding along with her TA's about student's difficulties due to the pandemic and if needed was kind enough to be flexible.

A personal issue arose for her mid-semester so our only interactions were her pre-recorded lectures, but she seemed pretty chill. Her lectures aren't super connected to the readings, but if you have any basic knowledge of intersectional feminism, this class is a breeze. 1 midterm 1 final 3 in-class debates & tutorials account for your whole grade

Very tough grader. Class average on most assignments was not high and she rarely gives full marks to anyone. Syllabus, assignment criteria, and feedback were always vague and not helpful. Ask for help and she tells you to look at the syllabus. I would suggest taking a different class with someone else.

As it is a pandemic, I would have liked a little more compassion from Dr. Patterson. I felt that we were kinda being bombarded with work. Additionally, the instructions on assignments were NEVER clear, making it difficult to understand what we were even supposed to do.

FRIENDS THIS IS A WARNING. Professor Patterson is EXTREMELY unclear about her expectations, does not provide clear feedback, and the online delivery is overall just poor. DON'T DO IT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Overall a good prof. She replies to emails usually within 24 hours. 30% of the grade is discussion posts that she marks pretty easily, make sure not to use her lectures as sources but the readings. 2 (3000 words) written exams and 1 assignment, marked on the tougher side. If you focus your work on textbook material you will do good.
